{"step_by_step_thinking": "Inversion of the foot is the movement which turns the sole of the foot inward. The muscles that are primarily responsible for this action are the tibialis anterior and the tibialis posterior. The extensor hallucis longus also contributes to inversion. The peroneus longus, on the other hand, is a muscle that primarily works for eversion of the foot, which is the opposite movement of inversion.", "answer_choice": "D. Peroneus longus"}
